poem:
Title: "In Praise of the Small Plate"

Barely noticed, the ramen bowl 
Shaped by earthy resolve; a willing soul.
The chef, a stargazer, stirred his art;
Innocuous broth, with a hearty start.
From humble ingredients, magic unfurls,
Passion writ in ramen curls.
Reality gives birth, by chance or design,
In the crucible of a chef's divine.
Everyday People, the tale retold,
Of small things done right; audacious, bold.
